poem:
The Unhearing   

In chambers of power, the voices  
of the silent are drowned,  
sand swept by the dollars' storm.  
A senator stands, a finger raised,  
the whisper of Gaza caught in the folds  
of his robes. But the din remains,  
a blind resonance, echoing  
off walls where compassion falters.
